Question 73) Salamanca Declaration - 1994 We believe and proclaim that: every child has a fundamental right to education and the opportunity to achieve and maintain the proper learning level should be given; Every child has characteristics, interests, skills and learning needs that are unique; Educational systems should be designated and educational programs should be implemented to take into account the vast diversity of such characteristics and needs.
As a signatory to the statement cited, Brazil has committed the elaboration of educational public policies that contemplate the
A) Creation of privileges.
B) containment of spending.
C) plurality of the subjects.
D) Standardization of the curriculum.
E) appreciation of meritocracy.
